meanings.sent1: The buzzing mosquito pesters me all night long.
meanings.sent2: The little brother always pesters his older sister for attention.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy pesters the sleepy cat, trying to get it to play.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain pesters the farmers, delaying their harvest.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise of the construction site pestered the nearby residents.

meanings.definition: To trouble or harass with frequent requests or demands
meanings.sent1: The persistent salesman pesters customers to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent2: The telemarketer pestered the homeowner with multiple phone calls.
meanings.sent3: The curious child pestered the teacher with endless questions about dinosaurs.
meanings.sent4: The demanding boss pestered his employees for updates every hour.
meanings.sent5: The clingy friend pestered for attention, making it hard to focus on work.
